page.title: 18Henry Prince First School.1
page.content: Origins Henry Prince First School was built 136 years ago.The Reverend Charles Layard owned some land and genorously gave some to build a school on.The Derbyshire Advertiser at that time said At an early hour of the morning on Thursday 19th.April the bells of the pretty village of Mayfield,on the banks of the silvery Dove,rang out a joyous peal to announce to the inhabitants the opening of the elegant and substantially {erected school.' The school cost only 780 pounds.The money was raised by people of Mayfield.Henry Prince,himself,was a farmer.In his will he left 200 pounds to help the school.The next vicar gave another piece of land and they built a school house for the Headmaster to live in.There have been 8 Headmasters so far.
